dcterms:creator: Raghu Bollapragada
Richard Byrd
Jorge Nocedal
dcterms:description: The dataset is used to demonstrate adaptive sampling strategies for stochastic optimization, particularly focusing on the equivalence of different adaptive batch size selection strategies for Stochastic Gradient Descent methods.

dcterms:creator: Richard G Carter
dcterms:description: This dataset is referenced in the context of global convergence of trust region algorithms using inexact gradient information, relevant for understanding convergence properties in stochastic optimization.

dcterms:creator: Richard H Byrd
Gillian M Chin
Jorge Nocedal
Yuchen Wu
dcterms:description: The dataset is utilized for sample size selection in optimization methods for machine learning, providing insights into the statistical error associated with gradient estimators.

dcterms:creator: Fatemeh S Hashemi
Soumyadip Ghosh
Raghu Pasupathy
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses adaptive sampling rules for stochastic recursions, contributing to the understanding of sampling strategies in stochastic optimization.

dcterms:creator: Coralia Cartis
Katya Scheinberg
dcterms:description: The dataset provides a global convergence rate analysis of unconstrained optimization methods based on probabilistic models, relevant for understanding convergence in stochastic optimization.

dcterms:creator: Andre Carlon
Luis Espath
Rafael Lopez
Raul Tempone
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses multi-iteration stochastic optimizers, contributing to the understanding of optimization strategies in stochastic contexts.
